qualifiers.scope: Siting/placement of noise-producing service equipment on a lot
applicability: All service equipment classified as noise-producing
Explicit examples: pool equipment (P), air conditioning units (AC), generators (G)
exclusions: None stated beyond placement prohibitions captured in Conditions
qualifiers.notes: Figures A–C in Figure 27 illustrate compliant placements but do not add additional permissions beyond those stated.

variables.name: location_area
variables.description: Area of lot where equipment is sited

variables.name: street_side_yard_encroachment
variables.description: Distance equipment extends into street-side yard from the buildable area/setback line

constants.name: max_street_side_yard_encroachment
constants.source: General rule and Figure 27C callout '6' max.'

conditions.description: Equipment may not be located in front, rear, or interior-side yards.
Equipment may encroach into the street-side yard up to 6 ft.
conditions.logic: IF location_area == street_side_yard THEN street_side_yard_encroachment <= max_street_side_yard_encroachment

conditions.description: If located in the street-side yard, equipment still may not encroach into the front or rear yards.
conditions.logic: IF location_area == street_side_yard THEN location_area MUST NOT overlap front_yard OR rear_yard

conditions.description: Placement within the buildable area is permitted.

relationships.description: Placement must maintain minimum driveway clearance where applicable (see R5).

rules.title: Acoustic insulation and housing requirements; waiver process

qualifiers.scope: Noise attenuation features for noise-producing service equipment

variables.name: located_in_buildable_area
variables.description: Whether equipment is located within the buildable area

variables.name: noise_specifications
variables.description: Manufacturer or measured equipment noise specifications used to demonstrate compliance

variables.name: screening_or_buffering
variables.description: Physical screening/buffering measures used to reduce noise

variables.name: assures_ordinance_compliance_at_nearest_lot_line
variables.description: Determination that combination of factors ensures compliance with City Noise Ordinance at the nearest lot line

conditions.description: Equipment must be insulated and housed unless waived by the Planning Department.
conditions.logic: insulated == true AND housed == true UNLESS waiver_granted == true

conditions.description: Planning Department waiver criteria for insulation/housing.
conditions.logic: IF located_in_buildable_area == true AND assures_ordinance_compliance_at_nearest_lot_line == true THEN waiver_granted == true
conditions.notes: Compliance determination is against the City’s Noise Ordinance at the nearest lot line.

exceptions.description: If waiver granted per R2-C2, the insulation and housing requirement in R2-C1 is not required.

relationships.description: Waiver is contingent upon demonstrating compliance with the City’s Noise Ordinance (Chapter 9.10) at the nearest lot line.

qualifiers.scope: Operational noise limits for service equipment
references: City Noise Ordinance, Municipal Code Chapter 9.10

variables.name: equipment_noise_level
variables.description: Measured or specified noise level of equipment as required by Chapter 9.10
variables.notes: Exact limits and measurement protocols are defined in Chapter 9.10 and not provided in this text.

variables.name: measurement_location
variables.description: Location at which compliance is evaluated

constants.name: noise_standard_reference
constants.notes: Numeric limits to be sourced from the referenced ordinance.

conditions.description: All service equipment must meet the City’s Noise Ordinance.

relationships.description: R2 waiver decisions rely on compliance with R3 at the nearest lot line.

qualifiers.scope: Replacement of existing noise-producing service equipment

variables.name: feasible_to_conform
variables.description: Feasibility of conforming to all requirements in this section
variables.notes: Feasibility is not defined in the text and requires administrative determination.

conditions.description: Replacement of equipment shall conform to this section where feasible.
conditions.logic: IF feasible_to_conform == true THEN replacement MUST comply with R1, R2, and R3

exceptions.description: If not feasible, replacement may deviate from full conformance.
exceptions.notes: Criteria for determining infeasibility are not specified.

relationships.description: Replacement conformance includes acoustic treatment requirements and waiver criteria.
Replacement conformance includes compliance with Noise Ordinance.

rules.title: Driveway clearance constraint (related to equipment placement)

qualifiers.scope: Minimum clear width for driveway where equipment placement could affect clearance
applicability: Any equipment placement adjacent to or affecting a driveway
qualifiers.notes: Cited in Figure 27A as an existing 'required 10' min. clearance for the driveway'; treated as a related constraint impacting placement.

variables.name: driveway_clear_width
variables.description: Clear width maintained for the driveway

constants.name: driveway_min_clear_width
constants.source: Figure 27A label '10' min. clear' and accompanying note

relationships.description: Placement of equipment must not reduce driveway clearance below minimum.

ambiguities.text: “Must be insulated and housed” lacks specific performance criteria for insulation/housing.
ambiguities.impact: Cannot validate specific materials or STC/Rw ratings without additional standards.

ambiguities.text: “Combination of noise specifications, location, and/or other screening or buffering” is open-ended.
ambiguities.impact: Validator requires administrative determination of adequacy; not fully automatable.
Feasibility requires case-by-case determination; automated validation should flag for review.

ambiguities.text: Driveway 10' minimum clearance is referenced via figure caption/label, not in the general rule text.
ambiguities.impact: If the driveway clearance standard is codified elsewhere, reference should be verified; otherwise treat as advisory unless confirmed.
